module.title: mòran a bharrachd (air)
module.p: mòran a bharrachd (air) is an expression of quantity equivalent to the English many more. It is derived from the quantity noun mòran large quantity modified by the prepositional compound a bharrachd (air) in addition.

When mòran a bharrachd is used on its own, without a specifier or any modifiers, both the standard of comparison and the target of the comparison are implied by the context eg.
Tha trì coin aig Màiri ach tha mòran a bharrachd aig Dòmhnall. Mary has three dogs but Donald has many more [dogs than Mary has].

The standard of comparison is usually expressed as the specifier of mòran, particularly when the latter is a non-specified (ie. ‘indefinite’) noun eg.
Tha Màiri ag iarraidh mòran chon a bharrachd. Mary wants many more dogs [than she has at the moment].
As déidh na bliadhna 1887, nuair a thòisicheadh air iasgach geamhraidh an toiseach, chuireadh móran sgadain a bharrachd air tìr anns a’ chumantas gach bliadhna na rinneadh roimh an ám sin.
After 1887, when winter fishing was first started, many more herring were landed in general every year, compared to the previous year. td. 25
Bha i òg, cumadail, agus ged a bha i a cheart cho leisg ris, bha mòran a bharrachd tuigse aice air an t-Seilcheig.
She was young and shapely, and although she was just as lazy, she had much more intelligence than the Slug. td. 26

When the standard of comparison is pronominal or specified (ie. ‘definite’), it is usually expressed as the partitive mòran de ... a bharrachd eg.
Tha Màiri ag iarraidh mòran dhiubh a bharrachd. Mary wants many more of them.
Tha Màiri ag iarraidh mòran de na coin a bharrachd. Mary wants many more of the dogs.

However, there is some variation in usage to be found here.
Cha do chuir Diack mòran de chudthrom a bharrachd air na faclan mu dheireadh.
Diack did not put much more weight on the last words. td. 25
Agus dh’aithnich e anns a’ mhionaid nach robh còir aige an gunna a lasadh cho luath, ’s gu robh dùil aca ri mòran a bharrachd de dh’fhèidh na fhuair iad.
And he recognised immediately that he should not have fired the gun so soon, and that they had been expecting many more deer than they had gotten. td. 47

The target of comparison is usually expresed by the preposition air followed by the relative particle na eg.
Tha mòran chon a bharrachd aig Dòmhnall air na tha aig Màiri. Donald has many more dogs than Mary [does].
Tha mòran chon a bharrachd aig Dòmhnall air na tha cait aige. Donald has many more dogs than [he does] cats.
Tha feadhainn eile a cheart cho làidir de’n bheachd gu bheil Alba a’ pàidheadh a mach móran a bharrachd air na tha i a’ faotainn air ais.
There are others who are just as strongly of the opinion that Scotland is paying out much more than it is getting back. td. 69
“Feumaidh mi fios a chur gu mo bhean gum bi mi fada gun tilleadh,” arsa Seòras, a’ gabhail an airgid, mòran a bharrachd air na b’ fhiach a’ bhòidse.
“I have to let my wife know that I will away for a long time,” said George, taking the money, much more than the trip was worth. td. 98
Bha aon bhodach faisg oirnn, Ruairidh Alasdair, aig an robh tàbh a ghlacadh mòran èisg a bharrachd air na ghlacamaid le aon dubhan.
There was one old man near us, Roddy Alexander, who had a hand-net that could catch many more fish than we would catch with one hook. td. 118

Sometimes the preposition is dropped.
As déidh na bliadhna 1887, nuair a thòisicheadh air iasgach geamhraidh an toiseach, chuireadh móran sgadain a bharrachd air tìr anns a’ chumantas gach bliadhna na rinneadh roimh an ám sin.
After 1887, when winter fishing was first started, many more herring were landed in general every year, compared to the previous year. td. 25
Agus dh’aithnich e anns a’ mhionaid nach robh còir aige an gunna a lasadh cho luath, ’s gu robh dùil aca ri mòran a bharrachd de dh’fhèidh na fhuair iad.
And he recognised immediately that he should not have fired the gun so soon, and that they had been expecting many more deer than they had gotten. td. 47

Note also cases where the target is expressed by a normal noun.
Bha i òg, cumadail, agus ged a bha i a cheart cho leisg ris, bha mòran a bharrachd tuigse aice air an t-Seilcheig.
She was young and shapely, and although she was just as lazy as him, she had much more intelligence than the Slug. td. 26
